description: Students will examine different facets of the visual document in art, journalism, and photography in this seminar-style course. They will be equipped with skills to analyse aspects of truth and realism that straddle documentary image-making and society, each developing and completing a documentary project during the course. There will be hands-on production, screenings, discussions and readings into the function and aesthetics of the documentary. Through these, students will learn a range of methodologies. In addition, the course will examine ways through which the documentary can inform, comment on and shape social and political concerns in everyday life.
title: The Document in Image-Making
